page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: This area is predominantly agricultural but also incorporates the northern outskirts of Torquay,part of the large dormitory village of Kingskerswell,the village of Coffinswell and the hamlets of Daccombe and Higher Rocombe Barton. The land is hilly rising to nearly 600 feet above sea level just beyond Haccombe Cross and communications in the hilly areas are by narrow lanes only.The main road and rail links out of Torquay to Newton Abbot and Exeter pas through the south_western corner of the block.The main features of the area are the residential portions of Torquay including some light industry and the attractive picture postcard village of Coffinswell.The number of bed and breakfast houses,caravan parks and hotels indicate that the primary concern of the area is tourism.
